Package sqltoregex.settings.regexgenerator.synonymgenerator

Class SynonymGenerator<A,S>

java.lang.Object
sqltoregex.settings.regexgenerator.RegExGenerator<S>
sqltoregex.settings.regexgenerator.synonymgenerator.SynonymGenerator<A,S>
Type Parameters:
A - class of added objects and class in which the synonym graph is built.
S - class of search objects
All Implemented Interfaces:
IRegExGenerator<S>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DateAndTimeFormatSynonymGenerator, StringSynonymGenerator
public abstract class SynonymGenerator<A,S> extends RegExGenerator<S>
Common Interface for all synonym managers. Provides functionality for adding, removing synonyms of a generic Type T. Generates RegEx with TemplateMethod generateSynonymRegexFor with implementations of preprocessor in concrete classes. With prepareSynonymForAdd(Object) and prepareSynonymForSearch(Object). It's possible to use a different syntax for Vertexes and SearchTerms as it's needed for Dates.

All of these methods are modeled on the java.util collections framework,accept for accessing so:

Adds a duplicate object to a set (e.g. when adding a vertex) is not an error, but the duplicate is discarded. Attempts to remove an object which was not part of the graph is not an error. But attempting to access an object which is not part of the graph is not allowed. Then there is just the synonym query returned.

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • prepareVertexForRegEx

      protected abstract String prepareVertexForRegEx(A syn, S wordToFindSynonyms)
      Makes it possible to manipulate the way a vertex class is converted into a String for RegEx usage without changing Object.toString(). Especially useful when A and S generics are different and toString() can't be used, because only returning object reference.
      Parameters:
      syn - vertex of graph
      wordToFindSynonyms - word, which is used for querying the graph. Especially useful if saved vertices class doesn't equal the search class.
      Returns:
      String representation of vertex useable for RegEx

    • removeSynonym

      Parameters:
      syn - the selected synonym
      Returns:
      boolean for remove operation success
